Visit Gallatin and NYU Undergraduate Readmission Financing Your Education  Success After Gallatin   Graduate                                              Share       Delicious     Digg This     Reddit        Stumble Upon     Technorati     Twitter        Facebook     Windows Live     Yahoo                 MySpace     Email                   Bread Crumbs                Home          >           Admissions          >           Undergraduate          >            Success After Gallatin                            Success After Gallatin        Gallatin undergraduates are committed to distinctive and unique educational endeavors. This drive is nurtured by Gallatin faculty and advisers, which allows students to develop the necessary skills to become creative thinkers and eclectic career-builders. Gallatin alumni include film directors, CEOs, composers, attorneys, journalists, physicians, architects, Tony Award-winning producers, and best-selling authors. Recent years have seen an outpouring:     A pioneering approach to improving computer memory.   An innovative stent to treat brain aneurysms.   A device that speeds the treatment of traumatic brain injuries.   A molecular sensor that diagnoses disease and may help in agriculture.   A new way for law enforcement to recover corrupted data.          Over the past decade, the pace of invention at NYU has more than doubled in number each year and licensing agreements have tripled, earning NYU $1.3 billion to further its research efforts. Dozens of products have been commercialized, and more than 100 startups have been launched to bring NYU innovations to market. These activities, and others, have attracted millions of dollars from venture capitalists, the federal government, the and the State of New York; produced new ventures, licenses and patents, and led to acquisitions by large corporations.                              Explore a sampling of NYU startups          AdSafe Media      Anaderm       Anzenna      Area/Code         Axonyx      BioDigital Systems       Brainscope       Constellation Pharmaceuticals      Diaspora       Digital Assembly       Dodgeball     Etsy       Media6Degrees      Networked Organisms      SkillSlate       Smart Therapeutics     Socialbomb         Spin Transfer Technologies       Sugen       SyntheZyme       The Hotlist                                            2013-2014 Entrepreneur Handbook Download your go-to guide about entrepreneurship at NYU! By The Numbers   Social Media   News & Events   NYU Stern Street Team     Academics Business Degree   Business & Political Economy Degree   Faculty   Academic Advising   Research   Practitioners Seminar   Stern Bulletin     Stern Around the World International Studies Program   Business & Political Economy Degree Program   Short-Term Immersions   Semester Away     Social Impact Social Impact Curriculum   Social Impact Initiatives     Dynamic Community Building Community   Living & Learning in New York City   Leadership Initiatives   Student Clubs and Organizations     Future Success Professional Development   Internships & Careers     Admissions Financial Aid   Transfer Applicants   Apply               Home / Programs & Admissions / Undergraduate / Future Success                        Share / Print                Print      Email      Share       Like                                                                   Take Action                     Visit Our Campus    Attend a Class    Apply to NYU Stern                                Future Success   Realize the potential of a Stern degree    Realize the potential of a Stern degree    Students leave the NYU Stern Undergraduate College with excellent preparation for the real-world – a strong intellectual foundation and practical experience. The Office of Student Engagement offers a variety of programs that support the professional of students to prepare for part time and full time opportunities.      Average Starting Salary: $67,250    Placement Rate: 98.21%    NYU's Wasserman Center for Career Development provides individual guidance and an array of services to help you secure internships, part-time positions, and full-time employment upon graduation. Visit our Internships and Careers page to learn more.                                       Earning a Stern Degree: Alumni Views      Ryan Lewis '13, Marketing Associate Analyst, PepsiCo                 Why Stern? Reason 8:     Unparalleled career prospects .  Whether you are looking for an internship or conducting your first full-time job search, through NYU’s Wasserman Center for Career Development you have access to thousands of top firms in New York City, and around the world. In a survey taken in 2014 , 98.21% of graduates were placed within six months of graduation. According to recent rankings, median starting salaries for recent graduates are among the top five highest at more than $67,250. Your access within NYC and beyond is extended by your connection to our more than 100,000 Stern alumni in 100+ countries around the world. If you have advanced degrees in your sights, your Stern education will prepare you well for virtually any post-baccalaureate studies ranging from law to medicine, or even doctoral studies.
